lines.text: [the girls are covering up the pizza guy's dead body]
He's dead all right. So cold.
Is the pizza?
[Jackie takes a slice of pizza]
Well life goes on after all and eating makes me feel best when I feel bad and boy do I feel bad.
[she takes a bite of the pizza]
I feel better already. Really, I do.
Y'know, I think your tits are getting bigger.
MINE?

[speaking for the first time; to Trish]
You're pretty. All of you are very pretty. I love you. It takes a lot of love for a person to... do this. You know you want it. You'll like it. Yes...
No... please... I don't even know you.
[the doorbell rings]
Who is it?

[distorted voice through the closed front door]
Pizza. Delivery.
What's the damage?
Six... so far.
Diane! You're a snob!
Hey, only the best people are, you know?
Look, what do you have against Valerie, anyway?
Nothing. She drinks too much milk.
What do all the guys see in Diane anyway?
She's beautiful.
I think she's got a big mouth.
Hey, it's not the size of your mouth; it's what's in it that counts.
What I don't see is what she sees in John Minor.
Maybe what we don't see.
Hey, it's not how big it is, remember?
It's what's in it that counts!

[in the middle of telling a story]
The woman gets up her courage and she throws her baby down, and the guy catches it. The crowd is going crazy, and the guy goes
[she imitates throwing something to the floor]
"TOUCHDOWN!"
[talking about the slumber party]
I don't know if I can go. My mom's on my case about my grades.
Mine too, but I'll be there!

[to Neil]
You know how girls love to scream.
[there's a knock at the front door]
Who is it?

[from outside]
We're here for the orgy.
[there's scratching on the door, accompanied by heavy panting]

[from outside]
Let us in! Let us in! Hurry!

[to Courtney]
It's too bad Mom and Dad didn't get a divorce before YOU were born.
I love you too.

[watching Kim change]
I don't think I've been giving Kim the attention she deserves.
[Jeff and Neil are watching the girls change through a window]
What'd we do to deserve this?
We died and went to heaven.

[reading Diane's horoscope]
"Your power with the opposite sex will get you ahead."
Not too bad.
Depends on whose head.
[Diane is talking on the phone with her boyfriend; the girls are downstairs listening on the other end]
I love it too. You think I'm getting better?
[downstairs, the girls break out in laughter, and Diane hears]
I think our first amendment's been violated.
Not the word I would have chosen.
Can't you take a joke?
Can't you get out of the third grade?

[getting flipped onto the ground]
Holy shit, I think you broke my back!
John Minor, what're you doing scaring me to death like that?
I won't do it again, that's for sure.
You better learn to fall better, you could get hurt.
You lock all the doors and windows.
Mom, I'm 18 years old, remember?
You will ALWAYS be my baby.
How come you weren't invited to the party?
I was, I just turned them down so I could take care of my darling little sister.
Like hell.
As the famous Jim Jones once said, 'Shut up and drink your Kool-Aid'.
Trish, the chips are under the sink and there's soda in the fridge, and our number at the hotel is right by the phone.
Okay, Mom, everything will be fine.
That's odd, none of the fuses are blown, but some of them are missing.

[counting the dead bodies]
1, 2, 3, 4... 4... Shit.
